alert.note: Alert for San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 08 at 2:55AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Santa Cruz and south central San Mateo Counties through 330 AM PST... At 254 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout 12 miles west of Ben Lomond, or 14 miles west of Santa Cruz, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Boulder Creek. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Santa Cruz Mountains
